name: Hilton Cairns

reviews.title: Great place to stay
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hilton Cairns for 3 nights and it was a great place.

reviews.title: quite nice
reviews.text: This was not bad for $170 a night at a 5 * hotel. Service was very friendly. Was able to give us an extended check out time.
Bed was nice and comfy, and they have a pillow menu for you to choose from- nice touch.
reviews.title: Pleasantly suprised

reviews.text: Nice views.
reviews.title: Great stay
Executive Floor Information
reviews.text: 3 and half stars

reviews.title: Absolutely fantastic!
reviews.text: My husband and spent our last night in australia at the Hilton. My husband and I are both Hilton Honor Gold members and we used points for our stay. As we pulled up to the hotel I saw there was major construction going on next door to a condo high rise. We got to the hotel around 10am and suprisingly our room was not only ready, but they upgraded up to a junior suite. Also, they did not have our room facing the construction site. We stayed on the 8th floor which is their spa floor. All the rooms have been re done and our corner junior sweet was fabulous. It had a walk in shower and spa tub with a rainfall shower head. All the products were Aveda which is a nice touch. We had two sliding glass doors, a bose sound system and a wonderful bed with lots of pillows. My only complaint about the hotel is that they don't have a spa on site. In the room they had a flyer for a traveling massage company that would give massages in your room but there were not any prices given. The hotel is across the street from the Sofitel casino and within walking distance of the lagoon and lots of shops and restaurants. We had just spent 5 nights at the Sheraton Mirage in Port Douglas( in a Mirage lagoon room) and we felt that the room at the Hilton was 100 times better. We had access to the executive lounge which was great. The staff there especially the woman at breakfast was wonderful. She gave us lots of info and tips and was very genuine.

The Cairns Hilton is a very good hotel, but where it really shines is in service. All of our interactions were very positive, but the Executive Floor staff team goes above and beyond. We mostly worked with Brandy and Anne, and also a bit with Jemma. They treat you with such consideration and care, and they are consummate professionals.
reviews.title: Executive Floor Offers Some of the World's Finest Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most hotels are abandoning top sheets, and when we asked Brandy late in the evening if sheets were available, she promised to handle it straightaway. When we went to the Executive Lounge for breakfast the next morning, Anne immediately asked if we received our top sheets, and we were taken aback that she had been made aware and were impressed that she made the effort to confirm that our needs had been met. Our entire experience mirrored that one example, and set a standard that would make even the Four Seasons envious.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: As for the rooms, ours was renovated, with tasteful fittings, very comfortable beds, and plush carpeting. The bath was quite clean, but small and not luxurious. The location at the Marina is ideal and the service was hands-down the best of our Australia travels, so I would absolutely stay there again, even though the room/bath struck me as a four-star standard rather than what I've come to expect of an international five-star.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel and a great location!!
Hilton should start caring about customers, not just money (2)
reviews.text: The hotel was excellent about granting my HHonors elite complimentary upgrade, but if you are not elite with Hilton, I would suggest paying a bit extra for the higher floors, better views, and superb service that come with the Executive rooms.

Checked out yesterday 24/11/09 after spending 7 nights at the Hilton. we have no complants at all. Location Perfect, food and service excellent, we would definately stay there again. we would reccomend a water facing room as high as possible ,floor 7 and above.
reviews.title: PARIS HILTON SHOULD SPEND LESS ON DRESSES AND MORE ON THE CAIRNS HILTON

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have read some of the less than glowing reviews on here and don't know what people are comparing the Hilton to. In my opinion the Hilton and Reef Casino are together as the best hotels in Cairns city.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I find the northern beaches a little too remote and enjoy being in Cairns. Despite other comments the Hilton was not built in the 1960's but rather the 1980's. It was built to a high standard. Fast elevators, nice size rooms and full width balconies.
reviews.title: So glad I changed at the last minute

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are second to none and always smiled and greeted me - something that doesn't happen in many other places. The breakfast was awesome and I really have nothing serious to complain about.
reviews.title: i loved this hilton!

reviews.text: The parking is a slight hassle but $10 A DAY FOR VALET parking isn't too bad. The bathrooms are fairly much original but totally functional. Maybe some better lighting would be my only real issue.
reviews.title: Lovely location, lovely people, incredible stay

reviews.text: Subject to paying a reasonable rate I would be all for staying here again
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.text: I was met with a smile on arrival and the young girl at check-inn could not have assisted me better. The location is great and the rooms are very modern and clean. While internet is provided free in the lobby area, it costs in the rooms and breakfast also comes at a charge and these items are the only downsides. At a rate of $250 per night these small things shpuld be free. While not a great cost to the chain, the impact on the traveller is significant. Maybe they could learn from top line hotels in Asia where it is all inclusive. The Hilton is recommended for a very comfortable night's sleep.
reviews.title: Very comfortabe and welcoming

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not sure where to start with this review of the Hilton in Cairns. Our 4 nights stay didn't start very well: I had booked a room with a King-size bed, only to be told at check-in that they only had rooms with two double beds available (but with water views)... This happens, but you can understand that given that this was our honeymoon (!!), I was not particularly pleased and made it quite clear to the staff at the reception! And I have to say they really tried hard to find a solution, even if it took both me and my wife complaining about the situation (my wife was not very impressed with the ‘cleanness’ of the ironing board in our first room – I have to agree with her that one usually doesn’t expect to find melted cheese on it!). Melanie in particular was very helpful and apologetic. They ended up giving us champagne, chocolates, and complementary breakfast for the duration of our stay, which was very nice of them. And after one night in separate beds, they found us another room with a King bed, overlooking the city.
reviews.title: Great hotel, even better location

reviews.text: The views on the water or the city were equally nice. The lobby of the Hilton is spacious and beautiful and you can’t beat the location: 3min walk to the main wharf and 5min to Cairns’ main streets. Our room was not huge but more than big enough given that we were not there to spend time in the hotel but to explore the Reef and the beaches north of Cairns! The bed was comfy, the bathroom was well appointed, and the air conditioning very efficient. The choices for breakfast were quite impressive and I would highly recommend trying their waffles!! I’ll write a separate review about the Hanuman restaurant in the hotel, absolutely delicious, one of the best Indian meal I’ve ever had.
reviews.title: Would have liked to stay longer...

reviews.text: All in all, we loved our stay at the Hilton and even if it didn’t start very well, it all got resolved fairly quickly. I would highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Best Sleep in Cairns!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PS: I find it strange that people complain about the construction site next doors: how’s it that the hotel’s fault?? Plus, I really didn’t hear a lot of noises coming from it.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for just one night during our recent trip to Australia. I wish we had spent more time here. Cairns is a surprisingly delightful city and the hotel is a dream. Located with gorgeous views of the harbor, it is within easy walking distance to the promenade and the boats out to the reef. The staff was very helpful; the room was big and clean; and the pool was warm and clean.
reviews.title: What a pleasant surprise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location with views over the water and walking distance to restaurants, shopping and the lagoon. Great value wotif package that included a sumptuous buffet breakfast in the restaurant. Bed was very comfortable, not your usual hotel bed. Service was friendly and very good right from the first greeting. Could not fault this hotel in any way during our stay.
reviews.title: Excellent location, service and value
Super convenient location.
reviews.text: The location of the hotel can't be beat. Easy walk to the Marina and the Esplanade. Very good breakfast buffet. Room was showing a little bit of wear (hole in the bathtub enamel, for instance) but otherwise a very nice hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 5 nights to celebrate our anniversay and really enjoyed it. We were upgraded to a room with a view of the beautiful Trinity Inlet with a balcony to enjoy it from. The staff were as good as we have encountered anywhere and we congratulate whoever is responsible for staff training.
reviews.title: Loved this Hilton
A Great holiday
reviews.text: The position is excellent at the southern end of the marina and very close to several restaurants and the boat trips. The walk by the marina and along The Esplanade is very pleasant and the shops are a short walk away.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before booking with this hotel, please make sure that you are aware of the fact that this is one of the worst Hilton Hotels around. I was severely diasspointed. We weren't provided with the room we booked, the bedding configuration was wrong and they acted like it was our fault, the reception was rude, the AC sounded like a jet engine and overall left us with a bad experience of Cairns.
reviews.title: Very dissapointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stay for a week the week of sept 06, 2012. Extremely friendly staff! Very cleaned facilities. Breakfast was very well balanced and any special orders were happily taken and delivered to our table with minimal delay. Conveniently located in the Esplanade and close to the main docks for our tours. Beautiful view of the lagoon! Will definitely return to this hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recommend this hotel without hesitation!
reviews.title: Excellent services.

reviews.text: Great location. Thank you Taka, Doohee and Michael for your services and helpful suggestions. We were always greeted with friendly smiles. Great breakfast and housekeepping teams. Two complimentary bottles of water every night. Convinent location after tiring day from GBR tour.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very nice hotel and we enjoyed our stay. Breakfast was quite good. The staff were all very cheerful and helpful. We did walk to the train station to take the train to Kuranda, which was the hotel staff thought was too far away. Overall we had a very pleasant experience.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff, lobby is beautiful at night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked in and out of the hotel three times as we moved on to our Great Barrier Reef trip and two nights in Port Douglas. Each time we walked in the door we were treated as valued guests. Each time we were sent a welcoming letter and a box of sweets. The bellmen greeted us as old friends and helped us store our luggage and retrieve it with great efficiency. The most memorable person of our stays was Jemma, the hostess in the executive lounge. She helped us with our travel arrangements and put together some breakfast items, when she learned we'd be leaving too early for breakfast the next day. She went above and beyond her job, demonstrating such care and concern for her guests.
reviews.title: Best Service in the World

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been staying at a variety of hotels around the world. I have to say that the amentities, room and service put this hotel near the top of the list.
reviews.title: The Hilton's proximity to the marina is its best amenity.
Great Stay
reviews.text: This is an older property which appears rather dated. The pool is small and has only an obscured view of Trinity Inlet. One of the things that struck me was the lack of a doorman. The restaurant was undergoing renovations at the time of our stay. The Hilton does offer easy access to the boardwalk and the marina.
Location was perfect, many rooms with a view of the water. Service was friendly and professional. Getting to the pool was a little complicated, you might want to ask first to avoid getting lost.
reviews.title: A very satisfying stay.

reviews.text: This hotel has a great location. The rooms are a bit small, but the views are excellent. Our room was recently refurbished and twas in excellent shape. Very large pool area with hot tub. Staff was very friendly and accommodating.
reviews.title: Great Location, walk to everything, awesome pool!

reviews.text: I stayed here with my 10 yo son for two nights of our holiday on 1st and 2nd Oct 2012. Any concerns I had about noisy construction work based on earlier reviews were unfounded - we saw and heard nothing in the way of building work. We stayed on the 6th floor in a double deluxe room (622), and were delighted with this, as we'd asked for a quieter room. The rooms are carpeted and well furnished but a little on the small side for anything longer than a night or two. Then again the beds are divine - soft without being saggy. The view of the harbour was lovely, but if you've been spoiled as we have by living near near one of the world's most picturesque working harbours (Newcastle), you will find it peaceful to the point of being sleepy! You can imagine then that being woken by the sound of other guests' room doors closing behind them as they leave at 6.30 and 7 am isn't ideal - but this is the Hilton, and all the doors are heavy security doors that basically can't be shut without causing a loud click that reverberates off the tiled outdoor walkways to the rooms. Que cera. I just went back to sleep. The building is older and curiously shaped - the rooms are housed in two huge ellipses which join at each end like a pair of lips, surrounding a large central open-air atrium and lift shaft. From around the third floor up, on stepping outside your room you look down onto a glass greenhouse roof. From this end of the building parrots and lorikeets coukd be seen flitting around in nearby palms in the morning. The lifts are fast and smooth, and while we didnt swim in the pool it looked great. All in all this place delivers the luxury you expect from Hilton, but with a Cairns flavour. Be aware that concierge services for car parking at $15 a day really aren't optional, as if you want to park the car yourself they will bill you $9 every time you exit the car park. Internet access is $30 a day or part thereof with no option for anything cheaper, but there are three free pc's in the business services room. I couldn't get the free wireless in the lobby to work and was told the modem could only cope with around 10 connections at any given time. This is a big hotel, so dont stay here if walking any distance is a problem for you. The least of my annoyances was that it's hard to eat economically here if you want a balanced meal - Hanuman"s food is absolutely superb, but too dear for every night; while I wasn't overly impressed with Mondo"s menu downstairs - they had dishes in the $15 - 20 range, but they weren't balanced unless you ordered salad too. Having said that the room service meals were huge and big enough for two moderate eaters, and the kitchen staff like everyone else were extremely obliging. Overall you can't go far wrong staying here if you're flexible on Internet and food prices.
reviews.title: Luxury and service with a smile but costly on Internet, food and car.

reviews.text: This was the first time we stayed at a Hilton Hotel. The service was fantastic and location was perfect. The concierge was very helpful with regard to helping us park the van and trailer. The only downside was the room service - the meals were cold. When I checked out I mentioned that and the staff at reception gave me a discount for the room service. That is what I call service. The room itself could do with a revamp to meet the high standard of the Hilton chain. The buffet breakfast was delicious and the staff were very helpful and friendly. When I did the booking it was suggested I pay a little extra to get a bigger room and a better view. Not sure if that actuallly happened because the view from our room was over the construction site. Hope to stay at the Hilton again in the future in another city.
reviews.title: Review of my first time at Hilton, Cairns

reviews.text: I stayed at the Hilton Cairns for 1 night in September 2012. Although check-in time is 2pm, I was at the hotel at 9.30am (as my lift from Mission Beach was very early) and I was able to go straight up to my room as it was ready. A beautiful room on the 9th floor with wonderful views over the inlet. Everything extremely clean and well decorated, everything working and super comfortable! The staff were all very courteous and friendly, I will definitely return! Thank you Hilton Cairns.
reviews.title: perfect one-night stay

reviews.text: Just spent 3 nights at the Hilton. While it could do with a lick of paint, its a very good hotel that's perfectly located at the top end of the Esplanade. A 2 minute walk from the wharf where you'll pick up all the tourist boats to the reef etc.
reviews.title: Perfectly located Hilton with friendly staff
Hilton Cairns
reviews.text: In the lobby there is a bookings agent and while I only used them to book my bus to the airport, they were friendly and helpful, and didn't charge extra to book the bus.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for five nights in July. It is one of the nicest places I have stayed in and is in a fab location. Had large corner room with views over both the town and the sea. Can't fault the hotel at all. Very clean, well presented rooms with great tropical theme. Pool area nice too and was heated which was great considering the weather we had. Travelled up from Sydney for some sun but never saw it the whole week. Still warm though. Word of advice don't do a reef cruise unless it's a nice day. My other half was ill from when we left harbour at 8am til we returned at 6pm! Luckily for him he wasn't the only one! Cairns nice place but quite touristy so if you're not into that then you'll probably not like it too much.
reviews.title: Excellent, excellent, excelllent!

likes.liked: — The location and the size and style of rooms, the concierge
likes.disliked: — the stairway to the pool lets down rest of hotel decor

reviews.text: We stayed
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: in Cairns for 4 nights and were very happy in town compared to outside but I suppose
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.text: it depends what you're looking for. We were not going for the beaches. If you do
reviews.title: OK Hotel - But Why Stay in Cairns?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for four nights at end August. It's like going back in time to the 80's...perhaps this is when last this hotel had an upgrade. Very basic, nothing special, and overpriced for what you get.
reviews.title: Very Average!

reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights, easy to get two across from Casino and 10 minute walk to town center. Room on floor facing water was modern , nice pool, small but decent gym, good breakfast. Tour desk in lobby very helpful in setting some sightseeing
reviews.title: Casual well Located

reviews.text: Courteous staff, helpful concierge, excellant breakfast buffet. We stayed on the concierge floor and had unlimited drinks and a large variety of hors d'oeurves nightly. We shared the table with very interesting guests during cokktails but we could have opted for a private table. Room had a limited view of the harbor. Beautiful swimming pool. Excellent value!
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good central location. Staff in general friendly, but not always knowledgable. Although renovated, some of them where "surface" renovations only. Some room appliances did not function, and could not be corrected, however, we were offered to change the room.
reviews.title: Hotel renovation only partially successfully

reviews.text: This recently refurbished hotel is very comfortable and in a good location. Rooms have balconies which either look over the inlet or the city parklands. The beds were good and the bathroom clean. It is an easy walk to nearby restaurants or the lobby restaurant (Hanuman) is excellent. My only issue is the high cost of in-room wi-fi.
reviews.title: Comfortable in Cairns

description: Located in the heart of the city, the Hilton Cairns hotel is the perfect base for exploring the diverse wonders of this truly unique region, famous as the meeting place of two natural wonders, the Great Barrier Reef and World Heritage Rainforest. Our modern and inviting Cairns hotel rooms and suites are luxurious oases of comfort and convenience, offering pristine new bathrooms and spacious balconies with views of Trinity Inlet or Cairns Esplanade and the unique cityscape and blue-green mountain ranges beyond. Stay connected with the latest technology in the fully-equipped business centre. Enjoy relaxed, alfresco dining at the award-winning Mondo Café Bar and Grill on the waterfront, or discover exotic Asian flavors at Jimmy Shu's renowned Hanuman restaurant the Hilton Cairns hotel. Experience modern, tropical, paradise today!
